subject: RE: [junit] How to record test results in XML format
msgSnippet: Hi Jason, Thanks for your help!!!! When I execute sample build.xml, I am getting the following error: Unexpected element junit Following below is the sample
messageBody:
Hi Jason,

Thanks for your help!!!!

When I execute sample build.xml, I am getting the
following error:
"Unexpected element "junit"

Following below is the sample code:
<project name="Autotest" default="test">
<target name="run" />
<junit printsummary="true" >
<test
name="com.test.tc.autotest.checkClass"
outfile="results">
<formatter type="xml" />
</test>
</junit>

</project>

Please let me know where I am wrong.

Thanks & Regards,
Syed.



--- Jason Rogers <jacaetevha@...> wrote:
> go to http://jakarta.apache.org/ant
> download a binary (which includes documentation)
> set up your build script (read the documentation)
> run it (read the documentation)
>
> A simple build script may be (you'll want to replace
> all the hardcoded
> paths to properties):
>
> <project name="MyProject" default="tests">
> <path id="somePath">
> <pathelement location="lib/sub1/some1.jar"/>
> <pathelement location="lib/sub2/some2.jar"/>
> <pathelement location="lib/sub3/some3.jar"/>
> </path>
>
> <target name="tests" depends="build">
> <junit printsummary="yes" haltonfailure="no">
> <classpath refid="somePath"/>
>
> <formatter type="xml"/>
>
> <batchtest fork="yes" todir="reports">
> <fileset dir="build"/>
> </batchtest>
> </junit>
>
> <junitreport todir="reports">
> <fileset dir="reports">
> <include name="TEST-*.xml"/>
> </fileset>
> <report format="frames" todir="reports"/>
> </junitreport>
> </target>
>
> <target name="build">
> <javac
> srcdir="src"
> destdir="build">
> <classpath refid="somePath"/>
> </javac>
> </target>
> </project>
> On Tue, 2002-07-09 at 09:37, syed Anwaruddin wrote:
> Hi Scott,
>
> Thanks for the immediate reply!!!
>
> You mean, I need to install ANT module???
> I am very new to this. Please mail me one example OR
> atleast let me know where can I find the
> documentation
> for this.
>
> Thanks and Regards,
> Syed.
>
>
> --- Scott Stirling <scottstirling@...> wrote:
> > Easiest way to do it is use the JUnit tasks
> (<junit>
> > and <batchtest>) in
> > Ant, which will automatically output results in
> XML
> > format if you tell
> > them to. Then use <junitreport> to automatically
> > transform the XML into
> > a nice framed HTML report.
> >
> > Scott Stirling
> >
> > > -----Original Message-----
> > > From: s_thoda [mailto:s_thoda@...]
> > > Sent: Monday, July 08, 2002 5:28 PM
> > > To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> > > Subject: [junit] How to record test results in
> XML
> > format
> > >
> > >
> > > Hi All,
> > >
> > > We have an Autotest suit using Junit in my
> > project. We were
> > > generating .txt files to record all the test
> > results. I want to use
> > > XML for recording all the autotest results.
> Please
> > advice me on how
> > > to go about this.
> >
> >
> >
> >
>
>
